featured.text: With hot stoves, boiling water and sharp knives at hand, it is understandable that parents don’t want children in the kitchen when they’re making dinner.
It was a simple knife with one big blade, a can opener, and a screwdriver.
In 1884, Carl Elsener, head of the Swiss knife manufacturer Victorinox, seized that opportunity with both hands, and designed a soldier’s knife that the army loved.
A small knife can be worn with the kilt too.
The tines prevented meat from twisting or moving during carving and allowed food to slide off more easily than it would with a knife.

other.text: To introduce the functions of the Swiss army knife.
But its special multi-functional design later launched the knife as a global brand.

Interestingly, the Officer’s Knife was never given to those serving in the army.
However, it seems that “Schweizer Offizier Messer” was too difficult for them to say, so they just called it the Swiss army knife, and that is the name it is now known by all over the world. 41.

It was a lifesaver for Swiss knife makers, who were struggling to compete with cheaper German imports.
To emphasize the importance of the Swiss army knife.
The Swiss army needed a knife for every soldier.
Every good Swiss citizen had a knife in his pocket.
And as they could buy the Swiss army knife at shops on military bases, they bought huge quantities of them.
Swiss generals decided to issue each soldier a standard knife to serve both as a screwdriver and a can opener.

Who gave the name “the Swiss army knife” to the knife discussed in the passage? (A) Carl Elsener.
But the knife had humble beginnings.

definition.zh_def: 刀具，一種用於切割的工具，通常有鋒利的邊緣和手柄。
definition.en_def: A tool used for cutting, typically consisting of a sharp blade and a handle.
definition.example: She used a knife to slice the vegetables for the salad.
